column4: I just installed Ubuntu and I'm wondering what everyone uses to configure the runlevels?
I could just delete the symlinks by hand, but I'm hoping that there is a graphical prog for setting runlevels
why does Ubuntu's version of gnome not have the services-admin prog?
I can't find any docs on this either, can any one point me to docs on configuring runlevels?
Ubuntu, like Debian, does not play the runlevel game. 2->5 are equivalent.
update-rc.d
yes, I see that, but how do I turn on and off services?
/etc/init.d/something stop
so there's no graphical version of update-rc.d ?
I'm not familiar with one, but that doesn't mean one doesn't exist. Try searching via Google.
gnome comes with one, but it's not installed by ubuntu
it usually comes with gnome-system-tools, which ubuntu has, but without the services admin part
use x-window-system-core
ok, thanks
make one.
are there any GNUstep at all on ubuntu ?
packages that is
apt-cache search gnustep
I gotta install this thing first ;)
then use http://packages.ubuntu.com/
ah, thanks
